column4: i deleted my ~/.dmrc file, then created a new one with nothing in it, now I can't log in
what should be in my .dmrc file?
can someone just copy and paste their ~/.dmrc file? I deleted mine....
no need.. it gets remade if its gone
next time you log in via gdm it will get remade
when I log in, I just get a blank screen
plus its just 2 lines - that shoudlnt be causeing that.
dr_willis_znc: could you just tell me those two lines?
it just saves the session you selected int eh GDM menus
i imagine its COMPIZ causing your problems
lemme try that, i'll be back here if it doesn't work
i disabled visual effects, so i don't think i'm using compiz that much
i followed the instructions at http://www.ubuntuproductivity.com/journal/ubuntu/08/2008/fix-ubuntu-dmrc-permissions-error-on-login/ because i was having a .dmrc permission error
for some reaon i had s similer issue.. i disabled then reenabled compuiz and it workled then
but because i deleted my .dmrc file to try to solve it, i think i messed something up
ok, so how would i disable compiz from the terminal?
